I finally uninstalled the game and don't recommend it to anyone to play unless its an absolute last resort for your friends. 

After many hours and years in this game, a lot of fun and a lot *more* frustration and anger at not only a very toxic player base (which has then made it a fight to keep from being completely toxic myself, which I periodically fail) but also being a buggy game, I've finally realized that BHVR is never going to make the core changes necessary to make the game worth spending the time and money that I've already spent on it. (A shame, I know.) 

Aside from the issues with the players (on both the survivor and killer side), there are bugs and issues with the game that have been around since I started playing (on XBox) 3+ years ago. Everything from terrible matchmaking, to illogical hit and hurt boxes, to inconsistent connection between all players. Fundamental aspects of the game that need to be rectified to make it worth the number of people that play it and the money spent on it are left on the wayside in lieu of BHVR cash-grabbing through releasing new killers, survivors, and skins.

This game has potential to be great. But BHVR is okay with "addicting enough that it doesn't have to be good", which works really well and is really frustrating.

Break the cycle and the habit early--don't bother buying the game. If you have friends who play it, I can almost guarantee they're looking for a way out. Suggest something else to co-op instead of this. Save yourself the time, money, and the mental and emotional breakdown.

(edited for grammar)

最近スキルレートが実装されましたが、これが酷いです。
スキルレートとはいわゆる隠しステータスであるため、表面上のランク帯とは一切関係がありません。
そのため理解できないマッチングが発生しています。
私のランクは銅なのですが、格上である金帯のキラーとしかマッチしなくなってしまいました。
プレイ時間がまだ100時間もいっていないのに、なぜか、です。
有名なゲーム、Apexで例えるならダイヤ帯とゴールド帯がマッチするようなものです。
そのため負けが続き、負ければブラッドポイントは少ないしランクも下がる一方です。
正直、めちゃくちゃストレスが溜まります。
そのため新規購入を検討されている方にはお勧めしません。

This is the most calm and relaxing game I have ever played. It is like Powerwash Simulator in the sense that it is very satisfying. I love the feeling of dread and despair as I get struck down by Micheal and get my shoulder destroyed by the metal hook. I have lost all feeling in my body and gladly surrender my soul to the endless abyss and void that is DBD. Great game would recommend.

It was fun, until they introduced skill-based matchmaking. As usual for BHVR, they managed to mess it up horribly. For context, SBMMR is supposed to give each individual killer their own 'MMR'. So when I played a match as a killer I usually perform well on, I was expecting a difficult match. However, what ended up happening is that I (almost if not lowest rank) got machtched against 4 survivors of the HIGHEST RANK. I thought this was an error, so I tried it again with several other killers and got similar results EVERY TIME. 
The last straw for me was when I played a killer that I had literally never played, and got matched against 4-high rank survivors again, and they t-bagged and BM'd constantly. (I was also bronze 3 this entire time, constantly getting matched against high-rank killers) After a night of this bs, I called it quits. 
It's a good game, but the devs are probably some of the worst for a game as large as this - and I have 3000+ hours in TF2. They constantly make extremely questionable decisions, ignore the community, and have bugs that are still in the game YEARS after they were first discovered. Purchase at your own risk.

Started avidly playing this game before the new mmr system was implemented. I felt like before, atleast from a new players perspective the game had a decent match making system and it was quite unique, you were rewarded based on preformence, simple and easy. Now thought I must express my growing dislike towards the game and the new match making system, on both ends of the spectrum survivor and killer, it seems like the whole player base was jammed into one funnel and whatever came out the end of it was what you were placed, before the new system I was a rank 9 killer and rank 10 survivor. Now as survivor I get killers with hours in the thousand so often I find it almost never playable, none the less winnable, unless I use super meta perks, which really take the fun out of it for me, not only that but on the other side of it, as killer I dont think I played in a single match where there wasnt a survive with friends party, not to mention most of the people who i got a chance to look at on steam were no where near the same amount of playtime as myself, sometimes lower, often times much higher, I constantly felt like I had to run meta perks in order to find anyway of catching up during the match and with how the new placement system works, if I did well in just ONE game the system thought i was ready to handle some e-sports ready team running full meta perks and flashlights. I have to say I am very displeased with the direction this game is taking now and I dont think its healthy for the community or player base. There feels like there is no in between anymore for players like myself, You either lose horribly over and over, or run a party with friends or use super meta perks. Sad to see what could have been one of my new favorite games take such a turn.
